words.definition: To affect someone or something is to have an influence over them.
words.example: The student’s poor attitude affected the other students.

words.definition: An autograph is the written name of a famous person.
words.example: Everybody wanted the movie star’s autograph.

words.definition: A bead is a drop of liquid.
words.example: Beads of water collected outside the glass.

words.definition: To brew coffee or tea means to pour hot water over it.
words.example: Please brew a fresh pot of coffee.

words.definition: To charm someone is to please them with your personality.
words.example: Gail charmed everyone with her humorous stories.

words.definition: A destiny is all the things that happen or will happen to a person.
words.example: It was his destiny to become a great singer.

words.definition: A horn is a device that makes a loud noise.
words.example: The boy honked his horn while he rode his bicycle.

words.definition: When someone is irritable, they become annoyed or angry easily.
words.example: She is irritable when she doesn’t get enough sleep.

words.definition: To lag means to move more slowly than others.
words.example: The little girl lagged behind her parents on the walk.

words.definition: To maximize means to make something as big as possible.
words.example: Businesses try to maximize their profits.

words.definition: A nightmare is a very scary dream.
words.example: I had a nightmare about being chased by a monster.

words.definition: If food is nutritious, it helps your body grow and stay healthy.
words.example: Vegetables are a very nutritious food.

words.definition: Protein is a substance in food that helps the body grow.
words.example: Meat and beans are good sources of protein.

words.definition: A signature is your name written in your own way.
words.example: I need your signature on this document.

words.definition: Stuff is a word for things when you don't know their name.
words.example: There is a lot of stuff in the garage.

words.definition: The subconscious is the part of your mind that you are not aware of.
words.example: I have a subconscious fear of spiders.

words.definition: A van is a vehicle that is larger than a car.
words.example: We rented a van to move our furniture.

words.definition: To warn someone means to tell them of a possible danger.
words.example: The sign warned people about the thin ice.

words.definition: A workout is a period of physical exercise.
words.example: I go to the gym for a workout three times a week.

words.definition: To zoom means to move very quickly.
words.example: The race car zoomed past the other cars.
